alert.note: Alert for Gage; Jefferson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 1:27AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN JEFFERSON AND SOUTHWESTERN GAGE COUNTIES THROUGH 200 AM CDT... At 126 AM CDT, emergency management reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles south of Swanton to 3 miles southwest of Steele City. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Beatrice, Plymouth, Odell, Diller, Endicott, Jansen, Steele City, Harbine, Rock Creek Station State Historical Park, Cub Creek Recreational Area, Homestead National Historical Park, Ellis, and Camp Jefferson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
